The claim originated from a chain email: 000 doctors are not accepting patients with coverage bought on Affordable Care Act marketplaces.
The claim was based on an analysis condu: a self-described "center-right policy institute," which estimated that as many as 214,524 American physicians would not be participating in any Affordable Care Act exchange products.
The expert verified the claim by examini: finding that it was derived from the American Action Forum's analysis.
The expert also considered the nature of: explaining that doctors have the option to choose not to participate in the networks of policies purchased on exchanges, and insurance providers may also choose not to include certain doctors or health groups in marketplace policies.
